channel.title: The Dyslexic Bioinformatician on
channel.description: Recent content in The Dyslexic Bioinformatician on

item.description: Portfolio Pieces As a note, any GitHub commits reported as either dp24 or DLBPointon are my work. dp24 is a work based account and DLBPointon is my usual account.

Language Description Python 3 My first language, generalist JavaScript Used in multiple projects, web focused Bash Language of the command line Nextflow Written in Groovy, Data science pipelining language

Built whilst I was getting to documenting the organsisms I was working on in DTOL this little project allowed me to get to: know the Obsidian environment a bit better, improve my skills in JavaScript and create a local database on the bugs I like (bees and wasps).
A page for the projects i’m working on or planning to work on. In Active Development Project Description Type Stage [[Personal Projects/Vault]] My Raspberry Pi4 4gb OMV6 based NAS and media server.
The Traumatic Media DataBase is a project I started in 2021 in order to provide a simple way to search for media which may have a scenes that could be considered traumatic.

An Raspberry Pi4 4gb based NAS using OMV6 and Docker, that I also call ShortCrust. Hardware Hardware Description Raspberry Pi 4 4Gb + 32Gb SD card External HDD 4Tb External HDD 10 Tb Software Service Port Description Site Open Media Vault 6 10.
In the world of science ethics there is one protocol which stands above all else, the Ngoya Protocol. This protocol covers….

GitHub:: https://github.com/AlanTracey99/TeloSearch Contribution:: Nextflow DSL2, Python 3.9, bash Working with:: AT (colleague at Sanger) Topic:: Collaborative Project, Scaling a project to meet organisational goals
Description:: A gEVAL replacement, written in NextFlow and Python3
